citation.article-title: Proteiniphilum acetatigenes gen. nov., sp. nov., from a UASB reactor treating brewery wastewater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Proteiniphilum (Pro.tei′ni.phi.lum. N.L. neut. n. proteinum protein; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. neut. n. Proteiniphilum protein loving).
Microaerophilic or aerobic growth does not occur.
Cellular fatty acids mainly consist of iso-branched fatty acids, predominantly anteiso-C15 : 0.
Cytochrome oxidase and catalase are not produced.
Yeast extract and peptone can be used as energy sources.
Carbohydrates and alcohols are not used.
The major fermentation products from PY are acetic acid and propionic acid.
The G+C contents of the genomic DNA of the known strains of the type species are 46·6 and 48·9 mol%.
Only one species, Proteiniphilum acetatigenes, is described so far; this species has been designated the type species.
